answers.answer: with my health plan they will not do elective inductions at all, and wont induce till baby is at -least- 1 week late (41 weeks.) its not a good idea to induce early if there's no medical reason .. if your body isnt ready, the pitocin/etc may not work and you may be headed for a c-section.

I am scheduled to be induced on Monday.  I am 38 weeks today and if your doctor says the baby will be fine then I would go for it....he/she would not do it if it was not...so many people are induced now a days that I think you will be fine.

Big babies are good...not bad.  Your dr. doesn't have 100% accuracy on the size of your baby.  I call it the 'guesstimate'...it is a guess based on fundal height.  They can, and more often are about a pound off.  A pound is A LOT when something only weighs 7.I agree with the above.  Nobody WANTS to do the full 40 weeks, but that is part of the deal.  We all get tired of being pregnant....join the club. To naturally induce labor, have intercourse and remain active.  The more pressure that is put on the cervix will help facilitate labor.  In addition, semen has a natural way of softening the cervix when it is 'ready'.  You may do all these, and still not go into labor, because your not ready.The last thing you want is an induced labor that doesn't take, because your body wasn't ready. You don't just get to walk out of the hospital at the point, you will be thrown into surgery for an emergency c-section. It isn't worth 2 weeks of not being pregnant.My dr. wouldn't consider induction until I went 7 days past my due date.  I was induced 2X's, because my water was leaking.  The first was 4 days early, the second was 2 weeks early.  My body had already made its own progression prior to induction.  Good luck with your delivery!
I was induced with both of my children--after they were a week late.  They come out much healthier and weigh a little more--I think they are just a little more healthy to be bigger babies.

My doctor scheduled inductions after 39 weeks.  I was induced at 39 weeks 2 days.  Every doctor is different though on their feelings about inductions.  My two friends both had doctors who refused to induce.  I think 36-37 weeks is still a little too early unless medically necessary.  I think they would risk too much in liability by inducing without medical cause at that stage.  Good luck and I hope you're able to stay comfortable and enjoy your last few weeks!Amy

i agree with u! I am ready to be induced or have a c-section either way will be fine with me. My doctor has also said he expects a big baby from me due to gestatiional diabetes and if so then he would go ahead and do a c-section around 36 or 37 wks, but i'm not 36.2 wks and they scheduled an u/s for the 22nd for babies weight, but this will be the longest weight. i'll already be 38 wks by then!!!!!!!!!!!!! i can't take it!

my doc will do a request for scheduled induction as soon as the hospital he is delivering at allowsgenerally 38 weeks 3 daysBUt he has seen some miserable women so he has stretched teh truth about gestational diabetes or high blood pressure to be allowed to induce them at 37.5 weeks

Pregnancy is 40 wks!   Yes, it can be long and you can feel miserable but that's the way it is.  You commited to being pregnant and having a baby so you need to stick it out.When I was 37 wks I went into labor. That is considered full term so they let labor continue. He was delivered by emergency c-section and almost died.Please don't be so eager to rush things.

When I was pregnant with my daughter I was on bedrest the ENTIRE pregnancy....I was absolutely miserable....etc.  I went in to preterm labor 6 weeks early but we were able to stop it.  Once I hit 37 weeks...I BEGGED for an induction....I was SOOOOO miserable!  My doctor MADE me wait and was going to induce me at 39 weeks since I kept going in to labor.  The afternoon before I was scheduled to be induced I went in to labor on my own.  Oh...just so you know, the doctor estimated my daughters weight was going to be in the lower 6 pound region....I ended up giving birth to a 7 lb, 12 oz little girl.  THEY WERE ALMOST 2 POUNDS OFF!!!  Just hang in there....I know its miserable....but its totally worth it when you have a healthy baby!

question: Hello Ladies,Have any of you requested a scheduled induction and your doctor complied?  I am 32 weeks pregnant and my doctor has been telling me for a while that she is expecting a big baby.  I also really want her to be the doctor to deliver the baby, and I am tired of being pregnant and really DON'T want to go the full 40 weeks.  I was thinking of asking her about a scheduled induction between 37-38 weeks.  Any thoughts?
title: Scheduled Inductions By Request?
